triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: Software verification is the core discipline that the competition is based on and evaluates.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Formal verification is the fundamental approach used by the verification systems being evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: Reachability analysis is one of the key specifications evaluated in the competition's verification tasks.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Memory safety is a critical specification being verified in the competition's C and Java program verification tasks.

triples.name: Buffer overflow
triples.relevance: Buffer overflow detection (overflows specification) is one of the verification properties evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: Termination analysis is one of the specifications that the verification systems in the competition are tasked with verifying.

triples.name: Benchmarking
triples.relevance: Benchmarking is a key methodology of the competition for evaluating and comparing verification systems.

triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: Model checking is a formal verification technique used by the verification systems evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new witness validation competition track for evaluating verification witnesses and their quality.
